bioghist.p: The College of Physicians of Philadelphia, founded in 1787, is the oldest professional medical organization in the country. The College is home to the MÃ¼tter Museum and the Historical Medical Library. Through its program of lectures, workshops, and conferences, as well as through the C. Everett Koop Community Education Center and PhillyHealthInfo.org, an online health information resource, the College provides a place for both medical professionals and the general public to learn about medicine as both a science and as an art. The duties of the Treasurer of the College of Physicians include receiving all funds, including gifts and trusts, paying bills, keeping accounts of all committees, and submitting an annual financial report to the Council.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records from the Office of the Treasurer of the College of Physicians of Philadelphia. Materials include: cash book (1889-1895); receipts and financial reports (1901) bills, invoices, receipts and vouchers (1810-1905); accounting records, including cash books, ledgers, and disbursements (1919-1965); budget surveys, (1935-1941); ledgers, petty cash book, cash receipt books, contributions to permanent fund, and securities registers (1899-1961); fellowship ledgers (1960s-1980s); dues, bank account books, and check books (1906-1909); scrapbook on the Third Century Program Restoration Fund Campaign (1976-1977); financial investment and property records (1863-1988); papers related to the Stengel Portrait Fund; and insurance appraisals and policies.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
